content.sentence:
What does a food laboratory assistant do?

A Food Laboratory Assistant tests food samples for quality and safety.

What does a food laboratory assistant do?

He measures moisture, sugar, and fat content in different food products.

What does a food laboratory assistant do?

He uses laboratory equipment like balances, pH meters, and microscopes.

What does a food laboratory assistant do?

He throws waste materials into ordinary bins without checking.

What does a food laboratory assistant do?

He does not ignore safety rules when handling chemicals.

What does a food laboratory assistant do?

He wears gloves and a lab coat to protect himself from contamination.

What does a food laboratory assistant do?

He does not work alone; he works closely with food technologists and supervisors.

What does a food laboratory assistant do?

He cleans and sterilizes glassware and instruments after use.

What does a food laboratory assistant do?

He does not check the expiry dates of samples before testing.

What does a food laboratory assistant do?

He keeps detailed records of all test results in laboratory notebooks.

activity_b.text: A Food Laboratory Assistant tests food samples for quality and safety.
He measures moisture, sugar, and fat content in different food products.
He uses laboratory equipment like balances, pH meters, and microscopes.
He throws waste materials into ordinary bins without checking.
He does not ignore safety rules when handling chemicals.
He wears gloves and a lab coat to protect himself from contamination.
He does not work alone; he works closely with food technologists and supervisors.
He cleans and sterilizes glassware and instruments after use.
He does not check the expiry dates of samples before testing.
He keeps detailed records of all test results in laboratory notebooks.

content.intro: The Food Mixer 2000 is a powerful and efficient kitchen machine used for mixing, whipping, and kneading various food products.

subsections.subtitle: Main Parts
items: Control Knob – used to select speed levels for different ingredients.
Mixing Bowl – holds up to 4 litres of dough or batter.
Whisk Attachment – used for whipping cream or beating eggs.
Dough Hook – for kneading bread or pastry dough.
Beater Blade – for mixing batters and sauces.
Splash Guard – prevents ingredients from spilling out during operation.
Power Cord – connects the mixer to the electrical outlet.
Overheat Indicator – lights up if the motor becomes too hot.

steps: Place the mixer on a flat, dry surface.
Attach the mixing bowl and lock it securely in position.
Insert the required attachment depending on your task.
Plug in the power cord and turn the control knob to the desired speed.
Start with a low speed for dry ingredients and increase gradually.
Do not run the mixer continuously for more than 10 minutes.
If the Overheat Indicator turns on, switch off the mixer and allow it to cool.
Always unplug the unit before removing or cleaning attachments.
Wipe the body with a damp cloth and dry it completely after use.

items: Never place fingers or utensils inside the bowl while the mixer is running.
Avoid using the mixer with wet hands.
Do not immerse the motor housing in water.
Always ensure attachments are properly fitted before starting.
Use only original parts and accessories supplied by the manufacturer.
Clean attachments immediately after use to prevent food residue.
Grease the moving parts lightly once every six months.
Store the mixer in a cool, dry place when not in use.
